title: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-101 et seq., I request that the Arkansas Department of Corrections make the below documents available for copying or inspection. 

Please provide data sufficient to identify each person currently incarcerated in an Arkansas Division of Correction (“ADC”) facility based on a parole revocation. This includes any existing data compilation, including but not limited to any existing rosters of currently incarcerated people, that contains the following information: 

1) Name; 
2) ADC number; 
3) Admission date; 
4) Reason for admission; 
5) Current facility; and 
6) Projected release date. 

I ask that the Board provide the above records within three business days of receipt of this request, as required by Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(e). I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I also ask that the Board provide me with a fee estimate prior to fulfilling any request. 

Should any part of the above request be denied, I request the Board provide a written response citing the specific statutory exemption, as required by Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3). If some of the above records are disclosable and others exempt, please provide the disclosable documents and provide the exemption(s) preventing disclosure of the rest per Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(f). If any of the above documents are administratively controlled by a different custodian than the Board, I ask that the Board please provide those custodians’ information, per Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3)(C).   

Please note that I am a citizen of Arkansas, and I am using MuckRock’s services to help manage and track my request. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Matthew.

title: 911 call data to 3231 Riverport Rd, Memphis, TN 38109

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

CAD logs and 911 audio for calls for service to 3231 Riverport Rd, Memphis, TN 38109 between 2022-01-01 and 2024-11-18.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Insider Staff.

title: Dahlia tequila police report 2024 (Orange County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please send me the police reports

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Luis Blanco
